security: This document reveals intelligence collection activities related to the Pugwash Conference and the identification of U.S. participants, which could compromise intelligence sources and methods. Citing the warning notice: 'SENSITIVE INTELLIGENCE SOURCES AND METHODS'.
summary: This collection of documents includes a memorandum regarding a House Select Committee on Assassinations request for material on Abram Chayes, Monica Kramer, and Rita Naman, along with a memo detailing intelligence collection efforts related to the Pugwash Conference in Munich, Germany, in August 1977, including a list of attendees and questions for field offices.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents pertains to the House Select Committee on Assassinations' review of CIA materials, specifically a file on Abram Chayes and documents related to Monica Kramer and Rita Naman. Additionally, it includes a memorandum from August 1977, sent to various field offices, concerning the Pugwash Conference in Munich, Germany. The memo encloses a list of attendees, including Abram Chayes, Carl Djerassi, Paul Doty, and others, along with a set of questions from ORPA analysts intended to gather intelligence related to the conference and its participants, citing CISL, Objective Ala, and KIQ 90.
title: Material Reviewed at CIA Headquarters by House Select Committee on Assassinations Staff Members: CHAYES, ABRAM
recipient: DDO/ISS/IP/EIS, Chief, Boston Field Office, Chief, New York Field Office, Chief, San Francisco Field Office, Chief, Syracuse Field Office, Chief, Washington Field Office
sender: Ruth Elliff, Acting Chief, USSR-EE Collection Group, D73
